page.title: 02Bank Quay Industrial Area
page.content: This is one of the oldest industrial sites in the Warrington area.The land is located on the banks of the River Mersey,and was spelt on early maps"Bankey",which progressed to Bank Quay with the building of the quay beside the Mersey. From the late seventeenth century boats could transport goods in larger quantities and in less time than the cart and pack horse. Early industries on the river's banks included a copper works,a glass works,and a chemical works. Today the area is dominated by the Crosfields chemical works which is part of the Lever Brothers group.
